Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Permission system does n+1 queries to fetch users' organizations" (#7794) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
This line performs n+1 SQL queriers, where n is the number of organizations the user is in:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/90f8fbea00217db2e5d918e140621c0aea0ca12d/src/NuGetGallery.Services/Permissions/ActionRequiringEntityPermissions.cs#L79

For example, if I am a user in two organizations, the following SQL queries will be generated:

```sql
// Get my memberships
exec sp_executesql N'SELECT 
    [Extent1].[OrganizationKey] AS [OrganizationKey], 
    [Extent1].[MemberKey] AS [MemberKey], 
    [Extent1].[IsAdmin] AS [IsAdmin]
    FROM [dbo].[Memberships] AS [Extent1]
    WHERE [Extent1].[MemberKey] = @EntityKeyValue1',N'@EntityKeyValue1 int',@EntityKeyValue1=1

// Load the first organization
exec sp_executesql N'SELECT 
    ''0X0X'' AS [C1], 
    [Extent1].[Key] AS [Key], 
    [Extent2].[EmailAddress] AS [EmailAddress], 
    [Extent2].[UnconfirmedEmailAddress] AS [UnconfirmedEmailAddress], 
    [Extent2].[Username] AS [Username], 
    [Extent2].[EmailAllowed] AS [EmailAllowed], 
    [Extent2].[IsDeleted] AS [IsDeleted], 
    [Extent2].[EnableMultiFactorAuthentication] AS [EnableMultiFactorAuthentication], 
    [Extent2].[NotifyPackagePushed] AS [NotifyPackagePushed], 
    [Extent2].[EmailConfirmationToken] AS [EmailConfirmationToken], 
    [Extent2].[PasswordResetToken] AS [PasswordResetToken], 
    [Extent2].[PasswordResetTokenExpirationDate] AS [PasswordResetTokenExpirationDate], 
    [Extent2].[CreatedUtc] AS [CreatedUtc], 
    [Extent2].[LastFailedLoginUtc] AS [LastFailedLoginUtc], 
    [Extent2].[FailedLoginCount] AS [FailedLoginCount]
    FROM  [dbo].[Organizations] AS [Extent1]
    INNER JOIN [dbo].[Users] AS [Extent2] ON [Extent1].[Key] = [Extent2].[Key]
    WHERE [Extent1].[Key] = @EntityKeyValue1',N'@EntityKeyValue1 int',@EntityKeyValue1=3

//Load the second organization
exec sp_executesql N'SELECT 
    ''0X0X'' AS [C1], 
    [Extent1].[Key] AS [Key], 
    [Extent2].[EmailAddress] AS [EmailAddress], 
    [Extent2].[UnconfirmedEmailAddress] AS [UnconfirmedEmailAddress], 
    [Extent2].[Username] AS [Username], 
    [Extent2].[EmailAllowed] AS [EmailAllowed], 
    [Extent2].[IsDeleted] AS [IsDeleted], 
    [Extent2].[EnableMultiFactorAuthentication] AS [EnableMultiFactorAuthentication], 
    [Extent2].[NotifyPackagePushed] AS [NotifyPackagePushed], 
    [Extent2].[EmailConfirmationToken] AS [EmailConfirmationToken], 
    [Extent2].[PasswordResetToken] AS [PasswordResetToken], 
    [Extent2].[PasswordResetTokenExpirationDate] AS [PasswordResetTokenExpirationDate], 
    [Extent2].[CreatedUtc] AS [CreatedUtc], 
    [Extent2].[LastFailedLoginUtc] AS [LastFailedLoginUtc], 
    [Extent2].[FailedLoginCount] AS [FailedLoginCount]
    FROM  [dbo].[Organizations] AS [Extent1]
    INNER JOIN [dbo].[Users] AS [Extent2] ON [Extent1].[Key] = [Extent2].[Key]
    WHERE [Extent1].[Key] = @EntityKeyValue1',N'@EntityKeyValue1 int',@EntityKeyValue1=5
```

### Expected behavior
The user's organizations should be fetched with a single SQL query.

### Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

### Additional context
Add any other context about the problem here.

Opened issue "A new version of a package shows previous icon" (#7792) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I've recently pushed a release with a new icon, but I still se the previous one on NuGet.org.

**package link**:
https://www.nuget.org/packages/CSharpx/1.2.3-rc2

**github of the project**:
https://github.com/gsscoder/csharpx

I had to use deprecated `PackageIconUrl` because, it's seem impossible to point a file with `PackageIcon`.

Thanks in advance.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Remove unnecessary SQL query" (#7791) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The display package page gets data through lazy loading. One such lazily loaded queries was a repeat:

1. Eagerly load all versions of a package: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/90f8fbea00217db2e5d918e140621c0aea0ca12d/src/NuGetGallery/Controllers/PackagesController.cs#L800
1. Lazily load all versions of a package: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/90f8fbea00217db2e5d918e140621c0aea0ca12d/src/NuGetGallery/Helpers/ViewModelExtensions/DisplayPackageViewModelFactory.cs#L63

Given that the second query is redundant, I piped the data from the first query down to the view model factory.

Part of https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2910

There is a button "Clear All Nuget Cache(s)" in the NuGet Package Manager options dialog. By clicking on it all packages are removed from cache. But in most of cases we need remove only previous versions of each package. Could you add an extra button with desired behavior?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "GeneratePackageOnBuild is transitive through ProjectReference" (#8983) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
It appears that `GeneratePackageOnBuild` is transitive through a `ProjectReference`. For example,
- Given a project A with `GeneratePackageOnBuild`, `a.nupkg` will be generated in the output folder of A
- Given a project B with a `ProjectReference` to A, `a.nupkg` will _also_ be generated in the output folder of B

This seems like a bug (though maybe it's by design?). It's particularly problematic in CI scenarios where you want to build all projects and then crawl for packages to push. Because of this behavior, all your test project outputs will have the packages of the projects they're testing. Likewise, you'll end up with multiple copies of packages if any projects reference other projects.

In my opinion the behavior should be to generate and output a package only for the project that contains `GeneratePackageOnBuild`. Maybe I'm missing a way to disable that behavior?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget pack process loses file attributes" (#8846) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet.exe

NuGet version (3.4.4.1321):

OS version win10 v1607 (14393.321):

Worked before? Not sure maybe it was always like this:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a file with read-only attributes

2. Pack it into a nuget package using nuget pack (and a valid nuspec file)

3. Extract the file out of the nupkg 

4. Check the file attributes and see that the read-only attribute is gone

Why does the packing process lose the read-only file attribute?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cryptic 'Key not valid for use in specified state.' message for stored API key after user password change" (#8147) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
After changing the (Windows) user password on our CI build server the stored API key was no longer working. The error message from NuGet.exe was `Key not valid for use in specified state.`, which doesn't point to the cause of the problem. After setting the API key using `NuGet.exe SetApiKey ...` the encrypted value has changed.

I suspect NuGet derives the encrypted API key from the user password, a sensible message when the key fails to load would've saved me a couple of hours searching for the cause of this issue (the password was changed due to other infrastructure changes, so who'd expect the password change to be the cause of this problem?)

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):
NuGet.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):
4.5.1.4879

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):
NA

VS version (if appropriate):
NA

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):
Windows 8.1 Pro Build 9600

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:
Probably not, but unsure.

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Set an API key for a source using `NuGet.exe SetApiKey ...`
2. Verify the key works for the source (`NuGet.exe push` / `NuGet.exe delete`)
3. Change the Windows user password
4. Verify the key no longer works and NuGet.exe gives the specified error message
